 Searched for "Hi, I have just been informed that our pricing is showing on google search, however we have locksmith enabled for this reason"

Hi, I have been informed that our pricing is showing on the intenet. THis is very urgent that locksmith doesnt shpw this. I can see that an update occured on friday, but I did not do anything.   
  
We are a very sensitive company and its imperative that our pricing doesnt show. Please can you rectify this ASAP

Hey there,  
  
Jed here with the Locksmith app team, thanks for checking in about this, and sorry for the issues!  
  
Can you give me a bit more context regarding where your prices are showing up specifically? Is it inside of your Shopify Store?   
  
Or, Is it via a google search? If so, are there any particular search terms I could use to see this in action?  
  
As far as the theme update goes, this happens regularly as we make updates to the app, and it is most likely not related to this particular issue.  
  
-Jed

HI Jed,  
  
When you search for some of our products on google, they come up which is fair, but the pricing is coming up as well. We have a lock on that only lets pricing be shown if you have a certain word in your customer account. I think this is a recent thing. Please can you help? Why would this show if locksmith has hidden pricing?  
  
 ![image001.png@01DAC161.AEE01340](https://d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/inline/103446/7dcf9d5c5cf2afa913ea6b6734e40c5c48d69dc3/470120df8025ef036222865209d49ae88912e062/image001.png)

I totally get that you wouldn't want those prices displayed. The only issue is that I don't see the same on my end. For example, this is what I'm seeing on that same search:

![](https://d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/inline/103446/2aff4680425528fae0f72e75db22b5eae1f1e258/9f69d1bd96027050982fb3d73cb234233335962e/Screenshot-2024-06-18-at-12-42-09.png)

  
Can I ask, was the screenshot you took a recent one? Are you _currently_ seeing the prices exposed when you do that google search?   
  
Depending on when you set up your locks, or when this product was added and locked, removing prices from google is not instantaneous. It would only take effect after google re-indexed your site. So if that was a product you added recently, and it happened to be indexed while it wasn't locked, then perhaps it was just a delay?  
  
-Jed

HI Jed,  
  
I had to get these changed ASAP so had to work behind the scenes to change all the pricing to zero on our shop and contact google to get the pages updated, which in itself is not ideal. I have only done a few and not all of the prices on some of our products show. Which means as soon as I add the pricing back in and google reindexes, the prices will show again.  
  
Please can you advise why these were showing and what you can do to fix this? As we have locksmith for this reason. We cant make sales if all of our pricing is at zero at the moment.  
  
Otherwise we would need to look in to different ways of hiding this potentially without locksmith, but the ease of using the app was what we liked about it.  
  
Emma Bailey​​​​

Emma,  
  
Typically, Shopify signals the price of a product, to search engines, by using something like the following:  
  
`<meta property="og:price:amount" content="{{ product.price | money_without_currency | strip_html }}">`   
  
Locksmith, in turn, when not locking the entire page, can still prevent the the price from being indexed by hiding the above bit of code. I've double checked the snippets/meta-tags.liquid file in your theme to make sure that Locksmith is adding the code to hide this. And I've searched through the source code on your frontend and I am not finding the above snippet (which is the desired behavior).  
  
It's unclear how your prices could have been indexed considering all of that. Was something else changed, like did you recently switch around your themes or disable your locks in a way that could have left the prices temporarily exposed? If your price is somehow still getting indexed, it may be getting exposed in some other way, and I'm not 100% sure if Locksmith can prevent it.  
  
-Jed

Hi Jed,  
  
Would it be that I have now changed the pricing to zero? Happy to reinstate pricing on 1 product to share with you and you can review/test the coding?  
  
I note the pricing is coming up in Googles rich text (when the pricing was showing)

Emma,  
  
 If you were willing to update the price for one product so that I could investigate, that could definitely be help to see the problem in action.  
  
It's also worth pointing out, that even if the prices aren't showing on Google, it may still be possible for someone viewing the source or the page (or interacting with the browser console) to see the price. This is because of the presence of things like Google Analytics and other tools, which reproduce the price in the source - but not visually on the page - for their own usage. These are out of control of the Locksmith app. Just pointing this out since you mentioned the rich text restults for google.  
  
-Jed

> Sorry I am confused the below  
>   
> \<meta property="og:price:amount" content="{{ product.price | money\_without\_currency | strip\_html }}"\>  
>   
> Is showing at line 46 on the meta tags liquid file

  
It is still there in the metatags file, yes. But Locksmith has surrounded it in its own code, and it's NOT showing on the actual source code of the rendered page, which is the important part.  
  

> Happy to reinstate pricing on 1 product to share with you and you can review/test the coding?

  
If you were willing to update the price for one product so that I could investigate, that could definitely be help to see the problem in action.  
  
It's also worth pointing out, that even if the prices aren't showing on Google, it may still be possible for someone viewing the source or the page (or interacting with the browser console) to see the price. This is because of the presence of things like Google Analytics and other tools, which reproduce the price in the source - but not visually on the page - for their own usage. These are out of control of the Locksmith app. Just pointing this out since you mentioned the rich text restults for google.

Hi Jed,  
  
Ok great, thanks.  
  
Could the below on the source code (inspect) be a problem?  
  
Its currently zero as I updated but could google be pulling from this?  
  
\<meta property="og:price:amount" content="0.00"\>  
  
II turn right click blocker on so they hopefully cant inspect which should alleviate the pricing issue for tech savvy types  
  
Emma Bailey​​​​
